creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Dr Raymond and Hanako Weitzman
description: long sword: black cord wrapped handle; tiny raised emblem of samurai riding horse with bow and quiver on pommel; small metal detail of bow with arrows on either side of handle; relief scene of samurai swimming through water with sword above handle; richly decorated tsuba with scene of waterfall with scholars, trees, and highlighted in thin gold paint; black scabbard with blue and ochre cord
signed: Tsuba: Recto: [ 　藻柄子　入道宗典製 ] ; Verso:[  江刕　彦根住 ];
title: Long sword
